results.title: Birth without knives
results.brief_description:
Please note: This film contains footage of a home birth, including nudity.

Created by ‘Asphyxia’, this film talks about the concerns regarding pregnancy, avoiding a caesarean birth and having a home birth.

Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’.

results.title: The Naked Artist
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Robert Rosmarin
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.
Robert Rosmarin talks of the sometimes chaotic family-life of his childhood, reaching a climax with a tragic car accident which claimed the life of his mother. He talks about his on and off relationship with art, including participating in Spencer Tunick’s iconic crowd nude photographs taken on Princes Bridge in Melbourne.
results.description:

results.title: The Crying Game
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and John Wood
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.
This story made by John Wood talks about his uncontrallable bouts of crying. This is sometimes brought about by depression or anxiety. He has learned that the expression of emotion is very healthy.
results.description:

results.title: Kyara
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Hank Kerr
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.
This film is a message from Hank Kerr to his daughter, Kyara. It speaks about his alcoholism and determination to become a better person for the sake of his daughter. Kerr also talks about the jobs he has had including as a clown in the first Aboriginal Clown troop called the Oogadee Boogadees.
results.description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.

results.title: Un Drole de Paroissien = Thank Heaven for Small Favors
results.creator_credit: Jean-Pierre Mocky, Jerome Goulven and Henri Diamant-Berger
results.brief_description:
The Lachaunay family, high-born aristocrats, have fallen on hard times and must resort to stripping off the doors and panelling of their Paris appartment to use as firewood. They are also threatened with eviction, but never waver from their conviction that they were born not to work. One of them, the ultra-religious Georges resorts to stealing money from offertory boxes. This is a wonderfully provocative and anti-clerical comedy, served by a subtle and humourous performance by Bourvil.

Credits: Producers, Henri Diamant-Berger, Jerome Goulven ; director, Jean-Pierre Mocky ; writer, Alain Moury, Michel Servin ; photography, Leonce-Henri Burel ; music, Joseph Kosma ; art direction, Pierre Thyberhein.
Cast: Bourvil, Jean Poiret, Francis Blanche, Jean Yonnel, Jean Tissier, Solange Certain, Denise Peronne, Veronique Nordey, Jean Galland, Bernard Lavallette.
results.title_for_label: Un Drole de Paroissien = Thank Heaven for Small Favors
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean-Pierre Mocky, Jerome Goulven and Henri Diamant-Berger

results.title: Shadow of a doubt [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock, Jack H. Skirball and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Film noir is here disconcertingly located in the calm world of small town America with young Charlie becoming attached by telepathic bond to her psychopathic uncle Charlie when he comes to visit her family in Santa Rosa. Cast includes Joseph Cotten, Teresa Wright and Macdonald Carey.

holdings.name: DVD; Access Print (Section 1)

results.title: Telling tales
results.brief_description:
Telling Tales are real stories told and produced by people with a disability and those who are disadvantaged.

Telling Tales challenges the ‘norms’ as often represented by mainstream film with first person accounts that provide a real opportunity to be seen and heard. The stories explore personal journeys of identity, displacement, relationships, longing and memory.

Telling Tales was produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.
